revision.comment: Copying from [[Category:Chinese-American films]] to [[Category:American films]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = 9-Man | image = | alt = | caption = Official website | director = Ursula Liang | producer = Ursula Liang | starring = {{Plainlist| * [[Kevin Wong]] * Ty Hua * Jeff Chung * Robert Chung * Ray Szeto * Paul Chin * Patrick "2E" Chin * Wendall Chin * Henry Oi * Jimmy Wong * Wen Wei Lin }} | music = {{Plainlist| * Scott "[[CHOPS]]" Jung * Adam Rubenstein }} | cinematography = Ursula Liang | editing = Michelle Chang | released = {{Film date|2014|04|27|Independent Film Festival Boston|2015|05|05|United States}} | runtime = 89 minutes | country = United States | language = English & Chinese }} '''''9-Man''''' is a 2014 American [[documentary film]] about the sport [[9-man]] played in Chinatowns in the U.S. and Canada.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.9-man.com/synopsis/|title=Synopsis/Trailer|website=9-man.com|accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref> ''[[The New York Times]]'' called it "an absorbing documentary."<ref name="The New York Times">{{cite news|last= Genzlinger|first=Neil|title=Review: '9-Man' Is More Than a Game for Chinese-Americans|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/04/arts/television/review-9-man-is-more-than-a-game-for-chinese-americans.html?_r=0 |accessdate=8 July 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=3 May 2015}}</ref>
The film, which had its world premiere at [[IFFBoston]] on April 27, 2014,<ref name="Boston Globe">{{cite news|last=Shanahan|first=Mark|title=Newton's Ursula Liang debuts '9-Man'|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/names/2014/04/28/newton-ursula-liang-debuts-man/frDElKverC46rreMh1VNYJ/story.html |accessdate=8 July 2015|newspaper=[[The Boston Globe]]|date=29 April 2014}}</ref> won six film festival awards<ref name="9-Man website">{{cite web|url=http://www.9-man.com/awards|title=Awards|website=9-man.com|accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref> and was broadcast on the PBS [[World Channel]] series ''[[America ReFramed]]'' on May 5, 2015 and January 24, 2017.<ref name="WNYC">{{cite news|last=Hockenberry|first=John|title=A Game That Started with Segregation, Now Played with Pride|url=http://www.thetakeaway.org/story/game-started-segregation-now-played-pride/| accessdate=8 July 2015|website=The Takeaway|date=4 May 2015}}</ref> The film, which follows the all-male<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/16/nyregion/rogue-sport-lacks-sand-but-has-style-and-speed.html|title=Rogue Sport Lacks Sand but Has Style and speed|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref> sport of 9-man, was produced by a largely female crew, led by first-time director Ursula Liang and editor Michelle Chang.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2986300/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1|title=9-Man (2014) : Full Cast & Crew|website=IMDb.com|accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.9-man.com/team |title=Team — 9-Man |website=9-man.com |date= |accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref> Featured in the film are U.S. volleyball [[Olympic Games|Olympian]] and [[NBC]] commentator [[Kevin Wong]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ursula/9-man-a-streetball-battle-in-the-heart-of-chinatow|title=9-MAN — a streetball battle in the heart of Chinatown|work=Kickstarter}}</ref><ref name="Reappropriate">{{cite news|last=Fang|first=Jenn|title=Review: "9-Man" documentary is a complex, thought-provoking challenge to Asian American stereotypes|url=http://reappropriate.co/2014/04/review-9-man-documentary-is-a-complex-thought-provoking-challenge-to-asian-american-stereotypes|accessdate=8 July 2015|website=Reappropriate|date=28 April 2015}}</ref> and Chinatown historian [[John Kuo Wei Tchen]]. 9-Man also features the now deceased "mayor" of Boston's Chinatown, Reggie Wong,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/obituaries/articles/2011/04/07/reggie_wong_everyones_uncle_in_chinatown_68/ |title=Reggie Wong, 'everyone's uncle' in Chinatown, 68 - The Boston Globe |website=Boston.com |date=2011-04-07 |accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref> who was a leader in the [[9-man]] community.
9-Man was part of the SkyFest series on [[Virgin America]] airlines in the summer of 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.9-man.com/past-screenings/ |title=Past screenings – 9-Man |website=9-man.com |date=|accessdate=2015-12-10}}</ref>
The music for the film was written by Adam Rubenstein and Scott [[CHOPS]] Jung, the pioneering Chinese-American hip-hop producer and member of [[Mountain Brothers]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2986300/|title=9-Man (2014)|date=27 April 2014|work=IMDb|accessdate=17 January 2016}}</ref>
==Synopsis==
The documentary follows several modern-day 9-man teams throughout one season framed by a historical portrait of [[Chinatown]] history and the game of 9-man. The first act of the film introduces the Boston Knights, Washington CYC (Chinese Youth Club), Toronto Connex and the Boston Freemasons as they begin the season preparing for competition with other teams. As the first act closes you are introduced to a character from New York Haiyan Townsmen, and east coast regional teams compete in the New York Mini tournament crowning an early season favorite. The second act of the film introduces the history of the game—traveling to Toisan ([[Taishan, Guangdong|Taishan]]), China—and its modern day rules, which include limiting participation by players who are not "100% Chinese." The sport and isolation of the game are revealed as direct descendant of the [[Chinese Exclusion Act]] and racism faced by the community. The final act of the film unites the characters, teams and conflicts at the [[NACIVT]] championship tournament in Boston's Chinatown, setting up Olympian [[Kevin Wong]] as the player to beat. As teams fight for the title, they also bring to light the cultural belonging and loss of the modern Chinatown and 9-man community. The film concludes with a scene featuring the funeral of a beloved community member and another scene where 9-man leaders contemplate moving the tournament to a new city—with no Chinatown.<ref>9-man.vhx.tv</ref>
==Awards==
* Jury Award for Best Feature Documentary, CAAMFest <ref>http://caamedia.org/blog/2015/03/24/caamfest-2015-award-winners/</ref> * Audience Award, Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival<ref>http://www.9-man.com/awards/</ref> * Special Jury Prize: Best Director, Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival * Grand Jury Award, Best Documentary Feature, Austin Asian American Film Festival * Director's Choice Award, Seattle Asian American Film Festival * Audience Award, Best Feature Documentary, Boston Asian American Film Festival <ref>http://www.baaff.org/blog/boston-asian-american-film-festival-2014-audience-awards</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * {{IMDb title|2986300}}

revision.comment: /* 2018 UK/Ireland Tour */[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], replaced: a a → a using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{italic title}} {{Infobox Musical |name=A Spoonful of Sherman |image=A Spoonful Of Sherman April 2014 flyer.jpg |imagesize=220px |caption= St. James Theatre poster by Rebecca Pitt (Second Run) |music= [[Al Sherman]], [[Richard M. Sherman & Robert B. Sherman]] and [[Robert J. Sherman]] |lyrics= [[Al Sherman]], [[Richard M. Sherman & Robert B. Sherman]] and [[Robert J. Sherman]] |book= [[Robert J. Sherman]] |basis= |productions= 2014 [[West End theatre|London]]
2017 [[West End theatre|London]]
2018 UK/Ireland Tour |awards= }} '''''A Spoonful of Sherman''''' is a musical revue which premiered on January 6, 2014 at the [[St. James Theatre, London|St. James Theatre]] in London and which is currently poised for its first UK/Ireland tour.{{cite news|author1=Cheesman, Neil|title=First Tour Dates Announced for A Spoonful of Sherman|url=https://www.londontheatre1.com/news/191663/first-tour-dates-announced-for-a-spoonful-of-sherman/|accessdate=5 January 2018|publisher=''London Theatre 1''|date=December 20, 2017}} Originally produced, written and emceed by [[Robert J. Sherman]], ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' first served as the UK book launch for Sherman's [[Robert B. Sherman|father]]'s (posthumously released) autobiography: ''[[Moose: Chapters From My Life]]'' for which Sherman was also the book's editor. After each performance of that original run, Sherman participated in a book signing after the show. The show was billed as "A Celebration of the Life, Times and Songs of [[Robert B. Sherman]]" and was received extremely well by the crowd and the critics alike. The cast consisted of four rising [[West End theatre]] stars including Charlotte Wakefield, [[Emma Williams (actress)|Emma Williams]], [[Stuart Matthew Price]] and [[Greg Castiglioni]]. Musical Direction was provided by Colin Billing and the show was directed by [[Stewart Nicholls]].{{cite web|url=http://www.stjamestheatre.co.uk/events/a-spoonful-of-sherman/|title=St James Theatre - Events: A Spoonful of Sherman}} Lighting was designed by the show's Stage Manager Andrew Holton. In the 2017 version of the show, focus of the show's narrative shifted to both [[Sherman Brothers]]' lives as well as to the life of their father, [[Al Sherman]].{{cite news|last1=Marcolina|first1=Cindy|title=BWW Interview: Robert J. Sherman Talks A SPOONFUL OF SHERMAN|url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/westend/article/BWW-Interview-A-Spoonful-of-Sherman-with-the-Shows-Creator-and-Narrator-Robert-J-Sherman-20170822|accessdate=September 8, 2017|publisher=''BroadwayWorld.com''|date=August 22, 2017|language=English|quote=In that 2014, earlier incarnation of the show, my dad was the protagonist, the focus of the story I was trying to tell. In 2017 though, I knew we needed to shift the focus so that it also incorporated my uncle and grandfather's stories too. So the protagonist shifted. The new protagonist became "THE IDEA of The Sherman Brothers". It sounds like a peculiar sort of protagonist, I suppose - even to us "writer types". But when you realise that it was very much my grandfather's mission to have his two sons collaborate on songs together, very much in his footsteps, then you understand that the "idea of The Sherman Brothers" has a life and a personality of its own.}} ==Productions== The show was produced by [[MusicWorld (UK)]] in association with the [[St. James Theatre, London|St. James Theatre]], James Albrecht, Creative Director. Joanne Benjamin and Clive Chenery of The Entertainment Business provided General Management. ===2014 Productions=== ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' received outstanding notices, garnering four stars from Clive Davis of the [[London Times]]Davis, Clive. [http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/arts/stage/theatre/article3974955.ece "A Spoonful of Sherman at the St. James Theatre, SW1"] ''The Times'', January 15, 2014 as well as four and five star reviews from dozens of other papers and online reviewers.Shenton, Mark. [https://www.thestage.co.uk/reviews/2014/a-spoonful-of-sherman/ "A Spoonful of Sherman"] ''The Stage'', April 22, 2014Honoré, Patrick. [http://musicaltheatrereview.com/a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-studio-theatre/ "A Spoonful of Sherman – St James Studio Theatre"] ''Musical Theatre Review'', January 19, 2014{{cite web|url=http://www.whatsonstage.com/london-theatre/reviews/04-2014/a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-theatre_34264.html|author=Lawson, Rhiannon|title=A Spoonful of Sherman (St James Theatre)|date=April 26, 2014|work=whatsonstage.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ayoungertheatre.com/review-a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-theatre-2/|author=Anderson, Gemma|title=Review: A Spoonful of Sherman, St James Theatre|date=April 21, 2014|work=ayoungertheatre.com}} The show covered ninety years of Sherman songwriting (including material written by the Sherman Brothers' father, [[Al Sherman]] (who began writing music in the early 1920s.) Songs written by the younger Robert Sherman were also included in the show as well) but the focus of the evening was the music and lyrics of Robert B. Sherman and the [[Sherman Brothers]]. "In deciding what songs to select, particular emphasis was put on material that would propel the narrative of Robert B. Sherman's life story forward. My narration would then fill in the gaps. Of course almost all of the famous stuff made it in. ''[[Mary Poppins (film)|Mary Poppins]]'', ''[[Chitty Chitty Bang Bang]]'', ''[[The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh|Winnie the Pooh]]'' , ''[[The Jungle Book (1967 film)|The Jungle Book]]'' and "[[It's A Small World (After All)]]" were represented, but I'm particularly pleased that we were able to include some unexpected gems in the mix as well."[https://www.facebook.com/groups/SHERMANBROTHERS/ Robert J. Sherman comments on "A Spoonful of Sherman"] facebook.com, accessed August 1, 2015 ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' was so successful in its own right, that further shows were scheduled for April 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.theartsshelf.com/2014/02/21/critically-acclaimed-a-spoonful-of-sherman-returns-to-st-james-studio-from-tuesday-15-tuesday-22-april-2014/|author=Admin|title=Critically acclaimed ‘A Spoonful of Sherman’ returns to St James Studio From Tuesday 15 – Tuesday 22 April 2014|date=February 21, 2014|work=theartsshelf.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.playbill.com/article/a-spoonful-of-sherman-celebration-of-songs-by-three-generations-of-songwriters-to-be-reprised-at-londons-st-james-theatre-studio-com-215571|author=Shenton, Mark|title=''A Spoonful of Sherman,'' Celebration of Songs By Three Generations of Songwriters, to Be Reprised at London's St. James Theatre Studio|date=March 4, 2014|work=playbill.com}} ===2017 Production=== ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' returned to London, playing August 7 - 20, 2017 at "Live at Zédel". [[Helena Blackman]] and [[Daniel Boys]] starred alongside pianist/singer Christopher Hamilton. Narrating the show once again was [[Robert J. Sherman]].{{cite web|last1=Hanks-Farmer|first1=Caroline|title=A Spoonful of Sherman – Live at The Zedel until 20th August|url=https://www.carnstheatrepassion.com/review-spoonful-sherman/|website=Carns Theatre Passion|accessdate=15 August 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.brasseriezedel.com/live-at-zedel/a-spoonful-of-sherman|title=A Spoonful of Sherman|publisher=Live At Zedel (2017)}}{{cite news|last1=Hewis|first1=Ben|title=Casting announced for A Spoonful of Sherman at Live at Zedel|url=http://www.whatsonstage.com/london-theatre/news/casting-a-spoonful-of-sherman-live-at-zedel_43856.html|accessdate=25 July 2017|publisher=''What's On Stage''|date=13 June 2017}}{{cite news|last1=News Desk|title=Cast Announced For A SPOONFUL OF SHERMAN Live at Zédel|url=http://www.westendwilma.com/news-spoonful-of-sherman-zedel/|accessdate=25 July 2017|publisher=''West End Wilma''|date=14 June 2017}} While the book for the two 2014 productions largely remained the same, in the 2017 version, Sherman modified his script, removing emphasis on his father, [[Robert B. Sherman]]'s life and making the story more about both [[Sherman Brothers]] (Robert and [[Richard M. Sherman|Richard]]) and their Tin Pan Alley era songwriter father, [[Al Sherman]]. New musical arrangements were provided by [[Rowland Lee (composer)|Rowland Lee]]. Robert J. Sherman explained that changes had to do with the evolution of the show's purpose for being. In 2014 the show was designed merely to serve as a "happy memorial" to his recently deceased songwriter father, Robert B. Sherman. But as the show grew, it began to take on a life of its own, the purpose, and therefore, the focus of the show needed to change as well.{{cite news|last1=Johnson|first1=Paul|title=A Spoonful of Sherman Magic|url=http://www.sardinesmagazine.co.uk/atd/profiles/blog.php?blogID=1178&castingID=77|accessdate=22 February 2018|publisher=''Sardines Magazine''}} ===2018 UK/Ireland Tour=== On December 20, 2017, producers [[James Yeoburn]] of United Theatrical and Robert J. Sherman announced the launch of the first ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' UK/Ireland. The tour premiered on February 14, 2018 at the EM Forester Theatre in [[Tonbridge, Kent]] with its press night held on March 27 in [[Greenwich Theatre|Greenwich]]. The tour was a radical departure from the previous three productions. The evolution could be described as a morphing from a clever cabaret to a fully realized albeit minimalist, stage musical. Cast members for the tour include [[Sophie-Louise Dann]], [[Mark Read (singer)|Mark Read]], Glen Facey, Jenna Innes and Ben Stock. Directing and choreographing is [[Stewart Nicholls]]. A new book was devised by Robert Sherman. Stage and costume design is by Gabriella Slade and new musical arrangements and musical supervision is by [[Rowland Lee (composer)|Rowland Lee]]. Listed among the first tranche of tour venues are [[Pavilion Theatre (Bournemouth)|Pavilion Theatre]] ([[Bournemouth]]); [http://www.sthelenstheatreroyal.com/whats-on/ Theatre Royal] ([[St Helen's (London)|St. Helens]]); [[Tivoli Theatre, Aberdeen|Tivoli Theatre]] ([[Aberdeen]]); [[Eden Court Theatre|Eden Court]] ([[Inverness]]); [[Hippodrome]] ([[Darlington]]); [http://www.chequermead.org.uk| Chequer Mead] ([[East Grinstead]]); [[Yvonne Arnaud Theatre]] ([[Guildford]]); [[Theatre Royal, Windsor|Theatre Royal]] ([[Windsor, Berkshire|Windsor]]); [[Greenwich Theatre]] ([[London]]){{cite news|author1=BWW News Desk|title=Sherman Brothers Musical to Tour UK|url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/westend/article/Sherman-Brothers-Musical-to-Tour-UK-20171220|accessdate=22 December 2017|publisher=''BroadwayWorld.com''|date=December 20, 2017}}{{cite news|author1=Cheesman, Neil|title=First Tour Dates Announced for A Spoonful of Sherman|url=https://www.londontheatre1.com/news/191663/first-tour-dates-announced-for-a-spoonful-of-sherman/|accessdate=22 December 2017|publisher=''London Theatre 1''|date=December 20, 2017|quote=[[Robert J. Sherman]], son of [[Robert B. Sherman]] and a successful composer in his own right brings the utterly compelling story of one family’s century-long, award-winning musical journey to UK audiences in 2018.}} [https://buxtonoperahouse.org.uk/event/a-spoonful-of-sherman Buxton Opera House] ([[Buxton Opera House|Buxton]]); [https://www.swansea.gov.uk/ASpoonfulOfSherman| Swansea Grand Theatre] ([[Swansea Grand Theatre|Swansea]]); [http://www.harrogatetheatre.co.uk/whats-on/A-Spoonful-of-Sherman| Harrogate Theatre] ([[Harrogate]]); [https://www.theatkinson.co.uk/events/spoonful-sherman-100th-anniversary-tour/ Atkinson Theatre] ([[Southport]]); [http://www.queens-theatre.co.uk/whats-on/show/a-spoonful-of-sherman/ Queens Theatre] ([[Queen's Theatre, Hornchurch|Hornchurch]]); [https://www.shanklintheatre.com/events/a_spoonful_of_sherman/details.aspx Shanklin Theatre] ([[Shanklin|Isle of Wight]]); [http://tickets.newportlive.co.uk/en-GB/shows/a%20spoonful%20of%20sherman/events Riverfront Center Theatre], ([[Newport, Wales|Newport]]); [https://www.octagon-theatre.co.uk/whats-on/musicals/a-spoonful-of-sherman/3356?m=4&y=2018| Octagon Theatre] ([[Octagon Theatre|Yeovil]]); [https://swindontheatres.co.uk/Online/tickets-spoonful-of-sherman-swindon-2018| Wyvern Theatre] ([[Wyvern Theatre|Swindon]]); [https://newtheatreroyallincoln.ticketsolve.com/shows/873586342| Theatre Royal] ([[New Theatre Royal Lincoln|Lincoln]]); [https://www.parkwoodtheatres.co.uk/Playhouse-Theatre/show/b24bd4ae-3bd6-e711-8119-d1a137370c73/a-spoonful-of-sherman| Playhouse Theatre] ([[The Playhouse, Weston-super-Mare|Weston-super-Mare]]); [https://exeternorthcott.co.uk/calendar/a-spoonful-of-sherman/ Northcott Theatre] ([[Northcott Theatre|Exeter]]); [https://www.parkwoodtheatres.co.uk/Queens-Theatre/About-Us/ Queens Theatre], ([[Barnstaple]]); [https://theatreroyaldumfries.ticketsolve.com/shows/873587336/events/128525405/ Theatre Royal], ([[Dumfries]]); [[Beacon Arts Centre]], ([[Greenock]]); [http://www.everymancork.com/2018/05/a-spoonful-of-sherman/ Everyman Theatre] ([[Everyman Palace Theatre|Cork]]) and [http://www.paviliontheatre.ie/events/view/a-spoonful-of-sherman| Pavilion Theatre] ([[Dublin]]).{{cite web|title=A Spoonful of Sherman Tour Dates|url=http://www.aspoonfulofsherman.com/#tourdates|publisher=Small World International, Ltd.|accessdate=18 February 2018}} ==Origin of the Name== ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' is derived from the title of the popular song "[[A Spoonful of Sugar]]" from the successful 1964 [[Walt Disney]] musical motion picture, ''[[Mary Poppins (film)|Mary Poppins]]''. The song was written by the [[Sherman Brothers]]. ==Critical praise for ''A Spoonful of Sherman''== * Pete Shaw of '''[[Broadway Baby]]''' gave the show 5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: "There’s a light bulb moment in A Spoonful Of Sherman when you realise its magic lies not within its high production values, exquisite lighting, fantastic set, immaculate choreography or supremely talented cast, but with the memories these songs ignite...Ultimately, A Spoonful Of Sherman is a feel-good musical journey executed with polished flair."{{cite web|last1=Shaw|first1=Pete|title=A Spoonful Of Sherman|url=http://broadwaybaby.com/shows/a-spoonful-of-sherman/724174|website=BroadwayBaby.com|accessdate=30 March 2018|date=27 March 2018}} * Clive Davis of '''[[The London Times]]''' gave the show 4 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★, writing that it was: “A show that strings together one joyous hit after another, delivered by a first-rate quartet of singers.” * [[Mark Shenton]] of '''[[The Stage]]''' wrote, "There’s plenty to both surprise and delight here." * '''UK Theatre Web''' gave the show 5 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: “It really was supercalifragilisticexpialidocious. Riffs and mash-ups on Winnie The Pooh, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang, Mary Poppins and a smashing Al Sherman Medley made the evening all too short, all too few songs, all the more memorable. I feel privileged to have been there. A truly scrumptious smorgasbord of smash hits by the Sherman Brothers.”{{cite web|url=http://www.uktw.co.uk/news/A-Spoonful-of-Sherman/1556.html|author=Weston, Orlando|title=Robert J Sherman at the St James Theatre|date=January 14, 2014|work=uktw.co.uk}} * '''North West End''' gave the show 5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: "The Sherman Brothers might have said that a song must be Singable, Sellable and Sincere. But, A Spoonful Of Sherman is Stylist, Slick and Superbly Sang throughout."{{cite web|last1=Cox|first1=Daniel|title=A Spoonful of Sherman - Theatre Royal, St Helens|url=http://www.northwestend.co.uk/index.php/professional-reviews/cheshire/2821-a-spoonful-of-sherman-theatre-royal-st-helens|website=North West End|accessdate=30 March 2018|archivedate=26 March 2018}} * '''Bargaintheatreland''' gave the show 5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: "Something magical happened at St James Theatre – it was a night of revelation, emotion and sheer joy."{{cite web|url=http://bargaintheatreland.com/a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-theatre-london/|author=Cronin, Caroline|title=A Spoonful of Sherman|date=January 13, 2014|work=bargaintheatreland.com}} * Jonathan Baz gave the show 4 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★ in 2014 writing: “It is a wonder that this charming show has not been staged before. Amidst all of Broadway’s giant songwriting partnerships, none reaches out to the child within us quite like the legacy of the Sherman Brothers. Cleverly crafted songs that speak of hope against adversity, written in verses that talk to every age. This show deserves to tour and when it comes to your town, don’t miss it!”{{cite web|url=http://www.jonathanbaz.com/2014/01/a-spoonful-of-sherman.html|author=Baz, Jonathan|title=A Spoonful of Sherman|date=January 14, 2014|work=jonathanbaz.com}} In 2017 Baz reviewed the show again, and once again gave the show 4 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: "...but for all the family’s multi-generational talent, this show lives and breathes the genius of the Sherman Brothers. Love, laughter and history – it’s all here in a charming evening’s entertainment."{{cite web|last1=Baz|first1=Jonathan|title=A Spoonful of Sherman|url=http://www.jonathanbaz.com/2017/08/a-spoonful-of-sherman-review.html|website=jonathanbaz.com|accessdate=16 August 2017|date=15 August 2017}} * Rhiannon Lawson of '''What's On Stage''' gave the show 4 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★ and wrote: "If you love a bit of nostaligia, enjoy flying a kite, singing with orangutans, feeding the birds or wondered what the wonderful thing about Tiggers is, you will have a Truly Scrumptious evening at A Spoonful of Sherman. Leaving the theatre with a spring in my step, I don't expect my sugar rush from this evening to be over for some time. * [[Phil Willmott]] of '''London Box Office''' gave the 2017 Zedel production 5 Stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ commenting: "Sherman himself has a charming and unassuming stage persona and when he's joined by the glossily accomplished trio of [[Helena Blackman]], [[Daniel Boys]], and singer/accompanist Christopher Hamilton the four have an enjoyably quirky chemistry on stage. Helena Blackman has a soaring gorgeous voice and is adept at conveying every nuance of a lyric. Aspiring musical theatre performers really should study her technique and Daniel Boys combines a rich and sumptuous vocal range with a delightful playfulness."{{cite news|last1=Willmott|first1=Phil|title=Review: A SPOONFUL OF SHERMAN at Zédel Brasserie|url=https://www.londonboxoffice.co.uk/news/post/review-spoonful-sherman|accessdate=September 8, 2017|publisher=''London Box Office''|date=August 17, 2017}} * [[Edward Seckerson]] wrote: “A cavalcade of Sherman, three generations, no medicine, just charm, and one or two genuine surprises...to demonstrate that the legacy lives on – “Music of the Spheres” by [[Robert J. Sherman]] (given a real sheen by Stuart Matthew Price). I want to hear that again, as I do “The Whistle Tune” from Busker Alley.”{{cite web|url=http://www.edwardseckerson.biz/asides/a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-theatre-studio/|author=Seckerson, Edward|title=A Spoonful of Sherman, St. James’ Theatre Studio|date=January 14, 2014|work=edwardseckerson.biz}} * '''Traffic Light Theatregoer''' wrote "Robert J. [Sherman]'s more recent works such as "[[Bumblescratch|Music Of The Spheres]]"...made ''A Spoonful Of Sherman'' a full-bodied experience for us. Helena Blackman soaring soprano easily encompassed a range of 20th century song styles from perky 1920s to near operetta to the limpid notes and musical hall idiom of Sherman Brothers' songs. Meanwhile Daniel Boys put his own Eastenders stamp on chimney sweep Bert's songs from Mary Poppins and the doowop jazzy Jungle Book numbers"{{cite news|last1=NewsDesk|title=A Spoonful of Sherman - Worth A Lot More Than Tuppence|url=http://trafficlighttheatregoer.blogspot.fr/2017/08/review-spoonful-of-sherman.html|accessdate=September 8, 2017|publisher=''Traffic Light Theatergoer''|date=August 11, 2017}} {{Infobox album | name = A Spoonful of Sherman | type = cast | artist = Original London Cast | cover = A_Spoonful_of_Sherman_2014-2015_Original_Cast_Recording_CD_Jewel_Case.jpg | alt = | released = {{Start date|df=yes|2015|07|13}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Musical Theatre]] | length = 91:51 | label = [[SimG Records]] | producer = [[Nick Lloyd Webber]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} * '''Remotegoat''' gave the show 5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing that it was: "Supercalifragilistic-expialidocious! An evening of magic and delight."{{cite web|url=http://www.remotegoat.com/uk/review_view.php?uid=10603|author=Waites, Aline|title="Sheer Musical Magic and Delight"|date=January 14, 2014|work=remotegoat.com}} * '''Musical Theatre Review''' wrote: "I predict a great future for A Spoonful of Sherman. Don’t miss this great cast!" * '''West End Wilma''' gave the show 5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ writing: "The audience were on the edge of their seats yearning for more."{{cite web|url=http://www.westendwilma.com/a-spoonful-of-sherman-returns-to-st-james-studio-15-22-april/|author=West End Wilma|title=Critically acclaimed ★★★★★ 5* A Spoonful of Sherman returns to St James Studio|date=February 10, 2014|work=westendwilma.com}} * '''The Public Reviews''' called the show: "Irresistible" giving it 4 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ “A delightful way to spend a couple of hours - great fun."{{cite web|url=http://www.thepublicreviews.com/a-spoonful-of-sherman-st-james-studio-london/|author=Foster, Ian|title=A Spoonful of Sherman – St James Studio, London|date=April 20, 2014|work=thepublicreviews.com}} * The '''Leighton Buzzard Observer''' wrote: “Walt Disney may have built a magical ‘toon empire but it was the Sherman Brothers who gave the mouse maestro his voice. A Spoonful of Sherman is a night of pure indulgence.”{{cite web|url=http://www.leightonbuzzardonline.co.uk/what-s-on/theatre/a-spoonful-of-sherman-review-teamwork-creates-a-dazzling-show-1-5807056|author=Cox, Anne|title=A Spoonful of Sherman - Teamwork Creates A Dazzling Show|date=January 14, 2014|work=Leighton Buzzard Observer online}} * '''Stagey Secrets''' wrote: “Truly scrumptious. The overwhelming power of their music is inescapable.”{{cite web|url=http://stageysecrets.com/2014/01/14/a-spoonful-of-sherman-review-130114/|author=Miles, Louise|title=A Spoonful of Sherman - Review 13/01/14|date=January 14, 2014|work=stageysecrets.com}} ==Original London Cast Recording== The double CD, Original London Cast Recording was recorded between July 2014 and February 2015. It was produced by [[Nicholas Lloyd Webber]] and mixed and engineered by Matthew Weir at the Palace Studios, located in London. Mastering was produced by [[SimG Records|Simon Grieff]] and engineered by Sam Featherstone at Price Recording. The executive producer of the album was [[Robert J. Sherman|Robert Sherman]] who also wrote and performed the narration and co-conceived the show with musical director, arranger and pianist, Colin Billing. It was released by [[SimG Records]] on July 13, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/A-SPOONFUL-OF-SHERMAN-Original-London-Cast-Recording-Out-Next-Week-20150709|author=BWW News Desk|title=A Spoonful of Sherman: Original London Cast Recording Out Next Week|date=July 9, 2015|work=broadwayworld.com}} CD available at [http://www.dresscircle.london/a-spoonful-of-sherman-original-london-cast-cd-4531-p.asp Dress Circle] Reviews of the CD were extremely favorable.{{cite web|url=http://mytheatremates.com/a-spoonful-of-sherman-cd-review/|author=Baz, Jonathan|title=A Spoonful of Sherman CD Review (5 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ ★) |date=July 12, 2015|work=jonathanbaz.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thepublicreviews.com/cd-review-a-spoonful-of-sherman/|author=Cooper, Jackson|title=CD Review: A Spoonful of Sherman (4 1/2 stars ★ ★ ★ ★ 1/2)|date=July 10, 2015|work=thepublicreviews.com}}{{cite web|url=http://musicaltheatrereview.com/cd-reviews-a-spoonful-of-sherman-lost-west-end-gypsy-the-scottsboro-boys-the-king-and-i/#.VexBOktgqqM|author=Wakeham, Nick|title=CD Reviews – ''A Spoonful of Sherman, Lost West End, Gypsy, The Scottsboro Boys, The King and I''|date=July 17, 2015|work=musicaltheatrereview.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.londontheatre1.com/news/109287/review-of-simg-records-a-spoonful-of-sherman/|author=Eastham, Terry|title=Review of SimG Record’s A Spoonful of Sherman (4 stars ★ ★ ★ ★)|date=July 7, 2015|work=London Theatre 1}}{{cite web|url=http://oughttobeclowns.blogspot.co.uk/2015/07/cd-review-spoonful-of-sherman-original.html|title=CD Review: A Spoonful of Sherman (Original London Cast Recording)|date=July 19, 2015|work=Ought To Be Clowns (blog spot)}}{{cite web|url=http://www.simgproductions.com/Records/A_Spoonful_of_Sherman.html|title=SimG Records: ''A Spoonful of Sherman: Original Cast Recording''|publisher=simgproductions.com|accessdate=March 27, 2016}} The cast recording was released digitally on [https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/spoonful-sherman-original/id1032890950 iTunes] September 7, 2015.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/spoonful-sherman-original/id1032890950|title=iTunes: A Spoonful of Sherman (Original London Cast Recording)|publisher=itunes.apple.com|accessdate=March 27, 2016}} ==External Links== * [http://www.aspoonfulofsherman.com ''A Spoonful Of Sherman'' Official Website] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uZVK-VA1MYo/ ''A Spoonful Of Sherman'' UK/Ireland Tour the Original London Cast Recording] * [https://www.facebook.com/shermanspoonful/videos/774789052705264/?fref=gs&dti=34071963505&hc_location=group ''A Spoonful of Sherman'' at Live At Zedel - 2017 page.title: Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny

revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny | image = Azoth.jpg | developer = [[Gust Co. Ltd.]] | publisher = {{vgrelease|JP|[[Gust Co. Ltd.]]|NA|[[Nippon Ichi Software|NIS America]]|EU|[[Koei]]|AUS|[[THQ]]}} | director = Kazushige Masuda | producer = Tadanobu Inoue | designer = | programmer = | artist = | writer = | composer = | series = ''[[Atelier (video game series)|Atelier]]'' | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]] | released = {{vgrelease|JP|May 26, 2005|NA|April 25, 2006|EU|September 29, 2006|AUS|October 12, 2006}} | genre = [[Role-playing video game|Role-playing]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }}
'''''Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny''''', released in Japan as {{nihongo|'''''Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana 2'''''|イリスのアトリエ エターナルマナ2|Irisu no Atorie Etānaru Mana Tsū}}, is a [[role-playing video game]] developed by Japanese developer [[Gust Co. Ltd.]] for the [[PlayStation 2]]. The game is the sequel to ''[[Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana]]''.
==Gameplay== Although ''Atelier Iris 2''{{'}}s combat system is an improvement from its predecessor's, out-of-battle gameplay is less complex and the alchemy and invention systems were merged. Battles are primarily [[turn-based]]. The game is unique in having two playable, switchable characters: Felt and Viese. Felt focuses on exploration and battle, and Viese on item creation and support. Only Viese can use alchemy, although Felt collects alchemical recipes.
''Atelier Iris 2'' has an item-customization and -creation scheme known as [[alchemy]]. By obtaining a recipe and the necessary ingredients, items can be synthesized for equipment or to progress in the game. Alchemy is divided into three categories: ''mana'' items, accessories and alchemy items.
Each character is equipped with a weapon and can equip two accessories and two alchemy items. As the player progresses through the game they will obtain a large number of Mana elements, which can be used to synthesize ''mana'' items.
Field play was simplified from the game's predecessor. Instead of possessing a number of tools to solve puzzles, each character has the ability to jump and absorb ''mana''.
Japanese voice-overs can be enabled.
==Plot== Felt and Viese, alchemists-in-training on the floating continent of Eden, are the game's main characters. Viese becomes a full-fledged alchemist, and when she finds Felt at the Belkhyde Gate (a sealed gateway to another world), they go to a forest so Viese can make a pact with an elemental spirit. They find the Azure Azoth, an [[Excaliber]]-like sword, and Felt succeeds in pulling it out.
He hears a voice telling him he must go to Belkhyde (which has been unsealed by the Azure Azoth) because Eden is in turmoil. After parting from Viese, he staggers across the Tatalian desert before collapsing and being found by Noin. Noin claims to be part of the Simsilt, an army fighting to liberate Belkhyde from the Empire. Felt and Noin rescue Max, leader of the Simsilt, from the Riesevelt lighthouse and move to Agito Cove (Simsilt's base). Felt and Viese learn about the Share Ring, which allows a user to send items to another. Hagel (the blacksmith) is recruited, and they are rescued by the dragon man Gray. Felt returns to Agito, travels to the eastern continent and sees the sea for the first time.
During the journey to Altena Church, Felt finds the girl who tried to kill him poisoned in a forest. After bringing her to Max's Camp, Viese develops a cure for Fungo's poison. Felt and the others go to Altena Church and are stopped by Chaos, who defeats Felt and Fee and is chased by Gray. When they reach Altena Church, the purposes of the Azoths, Eden and the Gardo Continental Drive are revealed. When Viese finds a map of workshops scattered across Belkhyde, this becomes the focus of the rest of the game.
Felt looks for Chaos, who was not present at the battle. He finds an Altena Nun on the bridge leading to the western continent who tells him that Chaos arrived at Altena Church. When Felt arrives, he finds Mother Eizlen frozen by the Crimson Azoth's spell (which killed Max earlier). Felt fights Chaos in the lower levels of Altena Church (where the Gardo Continental Drive is stored), and is fossilized with the Exzanosis spell. Viese begins to worry about Felt, and follows him to Belkhyde.
After the restoration of the Azure Azoth, Felt dissipates the mist which Palaxius spread over Eden. After chasing him to the Temple of Creation, Felt and his friends learn about Iris (the reincarnation of Lilith) and defeat Palaxius. Iris is freed, and everyone finds a place in the world.
==Characters== Similar to its predecessor, ''Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny'' has several playable characters. Three characters can be in a battle party at once, with the player free to switch the others in and out at any time.
==={{anchor|Main characters}}Main=== *{{nihongo|''Felt Blanchimont''|フェルト・ブランシモン}} {{Voiced by|[[Wataru Hatano]]|[[Spike Spencer]]}}: The protagonist of the game, Felt is a young alchemist who grew up in Eden. *{{nihongo|''Viese Blanchimont''|ヴィーゼ・ブランシモン}} {{Voiced by|Miwa Kouzuki|[[Michelle Ruff]]}}: Felt's childhood friend who stays behind in Eden to help from afar. *{{nihongo|''Noin''|ノイン}} {{Voiced by|Megumi Teranishi|[[Jessica Straus]]}}: The first person to join Felt after rescuing him in the desert *{{nihongo|''Fee''|フィー}} {{Voiced by|[[Natsumi Yanase]]|?}}: A mysterious woman *{{nihongo|''Poe''|ポウ}} {{Voiced by|[[Rie Kanda]]|[[Mona Marshall]]}}: A womanizing fairy who lives in Eden and pursues Viese. *{{nihongo|''Gray''|グレイ}} {{Voiced by|[[Kenta Miyake]]|[[Bob Papenbrook]]}}: A dragon-like former human knight.
==={{anchor|Supporting characters}}Supporting=== *{{nihongo|''Iris''|イリス}} {{Voiced by|[[Miki Takahashi]]|?}}: Title character of the "[[Atelier (video game series)|Atelier Iris]]" game series *{{nihongo|''Kreuz''|クロイツ}} {{Voiced by|[[Hiroshi Tsuchida]]|?}}: Head of the Eden Temple *{{nihongo|''Lutanus''|ルテネス}}: Wise Darkness Mana, who maintains the Eden Temple library *{{nihongo|''Meila''|メイラ}}: Green-haired girl who is a friend of Felt and Viese *{{nihongo|''Klavia''|歌姫クラウディア}}: Shy Sound Mana, who rarely speaks to anyone *{{nihongo|''Yacht''|ヤッケ}}: Noir shopkeeper with ties to Belkhyde *{{nihongo|''Melona''|メローネ}}: Light Mana who runs a shop next door to Viese and Felt's studio *{{nihongo|''Coco''|ココ}}: Clumsy Wind Mana who works in Melona's shop *{{nihongo|''Yuveria''|ユーヴェリア}} {{Voiced by|Shiho Kujima|?}}: Humanoid who guided Felt to Belkhyde *{{nihongo|''Mother Eizlen''|エーゼリン}}: Head of the Altena Church *{{nihongo|''Chaos''|ケイオス}} {{Voiced by|[[Hiroshi Tsuchida]]|[[Liam O'Brien]]}}: One of the game's main antagonists *{{nihongo|''Galahad''|ガラハド}} {{Voiced by|[[Hidenari Ugaki]]|[[Jamieson Price]]}}: Second Imperial Champion and Noin's father *{{nihongo|''Tolena''|トレーネ}} {{Voiced by|[[Haruhi Terada]]|?}}: Imperial Champion *{{nihongo|''Theodore''|テオドール}} {{Voiced by|[[Yoshimitsu Shimoyama]]|[[Richard Epcar]]}}: Consul of Riesevelt and leader of the Silvaresta Occupation Forces *{{nihongo|''Max''|マックス}} {{Voiced by|[[Kunihiro Kawamoto]]|?}}: Leader of the Simsilt Resistance Movement *{{nihongo|''Hagel''|ハゲル}} {{Voiced by|?|[[Kirk Thornton]]}}: Blacksmith and key member of the Simsilt Resistance Movement *{{nihongo|''Mitsue''|ミーツェ}} {{Voiced by|Shiho Kujima|[[Sandy Fox]]}}: Catgirl merchant and native of Zwital Village *{{nihongo|''Theresa''|テレッサ}}: Stylist from Grand City *{{nihongo|''The Azure Azoth (Elusmus)''|深蒼のアゾット/エラスムス}}: Titular Azoth of Destiny and Felt's main weapon *{{nihongo|''The Crimson Azoth (Palaxius)''|真紅のアゾット/パラケルスス}} {{Voiced by|?|[[Richard Epcar]]}}: The Azoth of Belkhyde, wielded by Chaos *''Rie'': Chaos' sister
===Mana=== As in ''Atelier Iris'', the driving forces behind the game's alchemy are the Mana spirits and Atelier Iris 2 has a greater number of Mana. The Mana and their element are: *{{nihongo|''Dour''|木のマナ・ドゥル}}: Wood *{{nihongo|''Zuvelk''|金のマナ・ツヴェルク}}: Metal *{{nihongo|''Uru''|火のマナ・ウル}}: Fire *{{nihongo|''Aroma''}}: Aroma *{{nihongo|''Plua''|闇のマナ・プルーア}}: Darkness *{{nihongo|''Diemia''|岩のマナ・ディエメア}}: Stone *{{nihongo|''Nymph''|水のマナ・ニンフ}}: Water *{{nihongo|''Silwest''|空のマナ・シルウェスト}}: Air *{{nihongo|''Jiptus''|毒のマナ・ジフトス}}: Poison *{{nihongo|''Faustus''|幻のマナ・ファウスタス}}: Illusion *{{nihongo|''Siren''|音のマナ・サイレン}}: Sound *{{nihongo|''Aion''|命のマナ・アイオン}}: Life *{{nihongo|''Eital''|光のマナ・エイテル}}: Light *{{nihongo|''Lilith''|無のマナ／原初マナ・リリス}}: Creation; all other Mana are her descendants.
==Music== Its soundtrack, composed by Ken Nakagawa and Daisuke Achiwa, was released May 18, 2005 in Japan by TEAM Entertainment. The opening song is "Eternal Story" by [[Haruka Shimotsuki]], and the ending song is ''"Tachidachi no Tobira"'' ("Door of Departure") by Mami Horie.
==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = 69.99%<ref name="GR">{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps2/926005-atelier-iris-2-the-azoth-of-destiny/index.html |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny for PlayStation 2 |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | MC = 68/100<ref name="MC">{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-2/atelier-iris-2-the-azoth-of-destiny |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny for PlayStation 2 Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | EuroG = 6/10<ref>{{cite web |last=Parkin |first=Simon |date=June 7, 2006 |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/ir_atelieriris2_ps2 |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | GSpot = 7/10<ref>{{cite web |last=Mueller |first=Greg |date=April 24, 2006 |url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/atelier-iris-2-the-azoth-of-destiny-review/1900-6148225/ |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny Review |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | GRadar = {{Rating|3.5|5}}<ref>{{cite web |last=Elston |first=Brett |date=April 24, 2006 |url=http://www.gamesradar.com/atelier-iris-2-the-azoth-of-destiny-review/ |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny Review |publisher=[[GamesRadar]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | IGN = 7.5/10<ref>{{cite web |last=Sullivan |first=Meghan |date=February 4, 2008 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2008/02/04/atelier-iris-2-the-azoth-of-destiny-review |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny Review |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | VG = 6/10<ref>{{cite web |last=Webber |first=Garry |date=October 19, 2006 |url=http://www.videogamer.com/ps2/atelier_iris_2/review.html |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny Review for PS2 |publisher=VideoGamer.com |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | rev1 = ''Future Gamez'' | rev1Score = 75%<ref>{{cite web|last=Warner |first=Dave |date=November 3, 2006 |url=http://www.futuregamez.net/ps2games/airis2/review.html |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny - PS2 Review |publisher=Future Gamez |accessdate=November 28, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303220138/http://www.futuregamez.net/ps2games/airis2/review.html |archivedate=March 3, 2016 |df= }}</ref> | rev2 = ''RPGFan'' | rev2Score = 89%<ref>{{cite web |last=Gann |first=Patrick |date=April 25, 2006 |url=http://www.rpgfan.com/reviews/atelieriris2/ |title=Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny |publisher=RPGFan |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | rev3 = ''Techgage'' | rev3Score = 7/10<ref>{{cite web |last=McPherson |first=Jen |date=June 15, 2006 |url=http://techgage.com/article/ps2_atelier_iris_2_-_the_azoth_of_destiny/2/ |title=PS2: Atelier Iris 2 - The Azoth of Destiny |publisher=Techgage |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> | rev4 = ''Video Game Talk'' | rev4Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}}<ref>{{cite web |last=Douglass Jr. |first=Todd |date=May 28, 2006 |url=http://www.videogametalk.com/reviews/404/atelier-iris-the-azoth-of-destiny/ |title=Atelier Iris: The Azoth of Destiny |publisher=Video Game Talk |accessdate=November 28, 2014}}</ref> }}
''Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny'' received mixed reviews. It received an aggregated score of 69.99% on [[GameRankings]] based on 43 reviews<ref name="GR"/> and 68/100 on [[Metacritic]] based on 34 reviews.<ref name="MC"/>

'''Audience superior position''' is a term in [[literary theory]] to describe when the audience of a narrative work knows more than one or more characters in the narrative work.<ref name="Write to TV">{{cite book| last = Cook| first = Martie| title = Write to TV: Out of Your Head and Onto the Screen| publisher = Focal Press| year = 2007| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=9_x98ufdB-4C}}</ref> An example in film might be when the audience knows the killer is hiding in the closet while the [[protagonist]] does not.
Another example of audience superior position is the use of [[Irony#Dramatic irony|dramatic irony]].<ref>[http://www.wordplayer.com/columns/wp48.Dramatic.Irony.html WordPlayer.com]</ref> For instance, the audience may know [[Oedipus Rex|Oedipus]] is headed for a tragic ending before Oedipus himself does.
Audience superior may also be used for [[foreshadowing]] or dramatic tension. The audience is aware there is a shark in the film [[Jaws (film)|Jaws]] long before the protagonists accept this fact.
==Audience inferior position==
'''Audience inferior position''' is when the audience knows less than one or more of the characters in a narrative work. A key example is in murder mysteries, when the detective solves the crime before the audience. If the audience were to solve the crime before the detective, the audience would lose all interest in following the story.
==Audience equal position==
Much of the time in narrative works, the audience knows exactly as much as the characters they are following, and are not given more or less information by the author.
==See also==
*[[Foreshadowing]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Concepts in film theory]] [[Category:Cinematic techniques]] [[Category:Narrative techniques]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = Be There or Be Square | image = | caption = | director = [[Feng Xiaogang]] | producer = Yang Hongguang, Liu Xiaodian | writer = Gu Xiaoyang
Feng Xiaogang | starring = [[Ge You]]
[[Xu Fan]] | music = San Bao | cinematography = Zhao Fei | editing = Zhou Ying | distributor = | released = 23 March 1998 | runtime = 103 min | country = China | language = [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]], [[English language|English]] | budget = {{Infobox name module | jianti =不见不散 | fanti =不見不散 | pinyin = Bújiàn búsàn}} | image_size = }} '''''Be There or Be Square''''' ({{zh|s=不见不散|t=不見不散|p=Bújiàn búsàn}}) is a 1998 [[Chinese cinema|Chinese]] [[romantic comedy]] [[film]] directed by [[Feng Xiaogang]], produced by Beijing Forbidden City Film Co. Ltd., Beijing Film Studio, Zhongji Modern Commercial, Beijing Zhengtian Media & Culture Centre, and Sleiman/Tyrol Films. [[Ge You]] and [[Xu Fan]] star as [[Beijing]] natives working in [[Los Angeles]], whose paths constantly cross in a foreign city. They attempt to balance work with friendship/love in spite of mounting disasters each time they meet. ==Plot== Freelancer Liu Yuan (Ge You) is a carefree Beijing native seeking out a living in Los Angeles, working as an occasional film extra and part-time insurance agent. While helping a Beijing film crew scout for a suburban mansion, he encounters Li Qing (Xu Fan), a former acquaintance [[house sitting]] for a wealthy Taiwanese family. Liu convinces Li Qing she lacks the requisite skills to survive in an American city, and buys her an air ticket to fly back to Beijing. The two part at the airport, expecting never to meet again. The two run into each other a year later in L.A. As it turns out Li did not leave the U.S.; instead, she now rents a cheap apartment and works as a cleaner. Still his former carefree self living in a [[travel trailer]], Liu has turned to selling cemetery plots. Their relationship seems "jinxed" as the two encounter a hold-up at a restaurant, then the unlucky duo end up arrested by the [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] after they worked for a traveling agency without realizing it is actually a human smuggling ring in disguise. Li Qing finds their relationship unnerving enough to stop contact, vowing never to meet Liu again. A year passes. Liu Yuan puts a classified ad in local Chinese language newspaper looking for Li, who now has her own florist shop and is teaching Mandarin part-time to Chinese Americans. Li remembers their relationship fondly and the two set up a Mandarin school for LAPD cops who patrol the LA Chinatown area. Through various mishaps, Liu makes no secret of his romantic interest in Li, but it is only after an elaborate hoax from Liu that Li realizes she values him as well. However, news arrives from Beijing that Liu's mother has suffered a serious [[cerebral hemorrhage]]. Liu heads back to Beijing to fulfill his filial duties and parts with Li, not wanting to pressure her to follow him home as Li has just obtained a [[Permanent residence (United States)|green card]] after years of hard work in the US. On the airplane heading home, Liu has a troubled dream that he will not see Li again until decades later at an old folks' home. When he wakes up he finds to his delight Li Qing sitting next to him. Just then, the airplane meets with technical mishap and seems to be heading for a crash – another mishap in their long line of "hexed" meet-ups. In the face of imminent death, the couple profess their love for each other, but miraculously, the technical problem is resolved just moments after their mutual love declarations. The two decide to get hitched immediately on landing – but only after Li discovers Liu is sporting dentures after their first kiss. ==Cast== *[[Ge You]] ''as'' Liu Yuan (刘元) *[[Xu Fan]] ''as'' Li Qing (李清) ==Box office and award== The film is a Feng Xiaogang ''hesui pian'' ("New Year celebratory film"), screened during the 1999 [[Chinese New Year]] to boost [[box office]] takings, and it earned 30M Yuan in theaters.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} It received the "Best Feature Film - Hua Biao Prize in 1998", awarded to the Beijing Forbidden City Film Co. Ltd., Beijing Film Studio, Zhongji Modern Commercial, Beijing Zhengtian Media & Culture Centre by the China State Administration of Broadcast, Film, & TV in May 1999.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} == External links== *{{IMDb title|id=0199354|title=Be There or Be Square}} *{{Amg movie|180068|Be There or Be Square}} *[http://www.dianying.com/en/title/bjb1998 ''Be There or Be Square''] at the Chinese Movie Database *{http://mall.cnki.net/onlineview/MagaView.aspx?fn=DYYS200003000*3-4*} {{Feng Xiaogang}} [[Category:1998 films]] [[Category:Chinese films]] [[Category:Mandarin-language films]] [[Category:1990s romantic comedy films]] [[Category:Films directed by Feng Xiaogang]] [[Category:Chinese romantic comedy films]] [[Category:Films set in the United States]]

{{Infobox video game | title = Bode Miller Alpine Skiing | image = Bode Miller Alpine Skiing Coverart.png | caption = Windows cover art | developer = [[49Games]] | publisher = [[Valcon Games]] (PS2)
[[Merscom]] (PC) | designer = | released = February 6, 2006 | genre = [[Sports game|Sports]], [[Skiing]] | modes = [[Single player]], [[Multiplayer video game|Multiplayer]] | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] }} '''''Bode Miller Alpine Skiing''''' is a [[PlayStation 2]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[video game]], named after the American [[alpine skier]] [[Bode Miller]]. It was developed by 49Games and published by Valcon Games. It was released on February 6, 2006. It is the first [[videogame console|console]] [[simulation|sim]] game to concentrate solely on the sport of [[skiing]] (not including skiing and snowboarding hybrid games){{Citation needed|date=March 2008}}. The four disciplines of skiing included are [[Downhill (ski competition)|Downhill]], [[Slalom skiing|Slalom]], [[Giant Slalom]], and [[Super-G]]. The game also includes a multi-season career mode, allowing the player to compete in a yearlong [[Alpine skiing World Cup|World Cup]] starting out as a junior skier, and the chance to qualify for the amateur and professional circuits while training, competing, and gaining sponsors. == Courses == *[[Åre|Aare, Sweden]] *[[Beaver Creek Resort|Beaver Creek, Colorado]] *[[Bormio|Bormio, Italy]] *[[Kitzbühel|Kitzbühel, Austria]] *[[Schladming|Schladming, Austria]] *[[Sölden|Sölden, Austria]] *[[Lake Louise, Alberta|Lake Louise, Canada]] *[[Chamonix|Chamonix, France]] *[[Garmisch, Germany]] *[[Alta Badia|Alta Badia, Italy]] *[[Madonna di Campiglio|Madonna di Campiglio, Italy]] *[[Val d'Isère|Val d'Isère, France]] *[[Val Gardena|Val Gardena, Italy]] *[[Adelboden|Adelboden, Switzerland]] *[[Wengen, Switzerland]] *[[Kranjska Gora|Kranjska Gora, Slovenia]] *[[Yongpyong Ski Resort|Yongpyong, South Korea]] *[[Shiga Kōgen|Shiga Kogen, Japan]] == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060219134716/http://www.bodemillergame.com/ Bode Miller Alpine Skiing] [[Category:2006 video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 games]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Skiing video games]] [[Category:Valcon Games games]] [[Category:Video games set in Canada]] [[Category:Video games set in Japan]] [[Category:Video games set in South Korea]] [[Category:Video games set in Switzerland]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of American people|Miller]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of sportspeople|Miller]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of men|Miller]] [[Category:Video games based on real people]] [[Category:Video games developed in Germany]] {{winter-sports-videogame-stub}}

revision.comment: Updated the reference to the source article originally published in Art & Text No.3, Melbourne, 1983
revision.text:
'''Body horror''' or '''biological horror''' is a subgenre of [[Horror film|horror]] which intentionally showcases graphic or psychologically disturbing violations of the human body.<ref name=":4">{{cite journal |last1=Cruz |first1=R. A. L. |title=Mutations and Metamorphoses: Body Horror is Biological Horror |journal=Journal of Popular Film and Television |date=2012 |volume=40 |issue=4 |pages=160–168 |doi=10.1080/01956051.2012.654521}}</ref> These violations may manifest through aberrant sex, mutations, mutilation, zombification, gratuitous violence, disease, or unnatural movements of the body. Body horror was a description originally applied to an emerging subgenre of American horror films, but has roots in early Gothic literature and has expanded to include other media.<ref name=":5">Halberstam, J. (1995). ''Skin shows: Gothic horror and the technology of monsters''. Duke University Press.</ref>
== Characteristics == Body horror falls into one of three "gross" genres or "genres of excess" which also includes [[pornography]] and [[melodrama]].<ref name=":0">{{cite journal |last1=Williams |first1=L. |title=Film Bodies: Gender, Genre, and Excess |journal=Film Quarterly |date=1991 |volume=44 |issue=4 |pages=2–13 |doi=10.2307/1212758}}</ref> According to film scholar [[Linda Williams (film scholar)|Linda Williams]], the success of these body genres "is often measured by the degree to which the audience sensation mimics what is seen on the screen".<ref name=":0" /> For example, an audience may experience feelings of terror through horror, sympathy through melodrama, or sexual arousal through pornography. Body horror specifically focuses on the limits and transformative capabilities of the human body.<ref name=":1">Cardin, Matt. (2017). Horror Literature Through History: an Encyclopedia of the Stories That Speak to Our Deepest Fears [2 Volumes]. Santa Barbara, California : Greenwood.</ref>
Body horror often overlaps with, but is distinct from, other horror subgenres. For example, while elements of mutilation may be present in body horror, other similar subgenres such as [[Slasher film|slasher]], [[Splatter film|splatter]], or [[Monster movie|monster]] horror may also share this trope, but differ in message and intent.<ref>Reyes, X. A. (2016). ''Horror Film and Affect: Towards a Corporeal Model of Viewership'' (Vol. 47), p. 16. Routledge.</ref> A common difference in the body horror genre is that violations or distortions of the body are rarely the result of immediate or initial violence. Instead, they are generally marked by a loss of conscious control over the body through mutation, disease, or other tropes involving uncontrolled transformation.<ref>Hutchings, Peter. (2009). The A–Z of Horror Cinema. A–Z Guides 100. Lanham, MD: Scarecrow Press.</ref> The genre can invoke intense feelings of physical and psychological disgust, or squick, and play upon anxieties of physical vulnerability.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://therumpus.net/2017/01/the-future-of-body-horror-can-our-art-keep-up-with-our-suffering/|title=The Future of Body Horror: Can Our Art Keep up with Our Suffering?|date=2017-01-26|work=The Rumpus.net|access-date=2018-03-15|language=en-US}}</ref> In addition to common tropes used within the broader horror genre, some tropes specific to the body horror subgenre may include invasion, contagion, mutation, transformation, disease, mutilation, or other unnatural or violent distortions of the human body.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror|title=Body Horror - TV Tropes|website=tvtropes.org|access-date=2018-04-01}}</ref>
== History == The terminology "body horror" was first used by Phillip Brophy in his 1989 article "Horrality: The Textuality of the Contemporary Horror Film."<ref name=":2">{{cite journal|last1=Brophy|first1=P.|date=1983|title=Horrality - The Textuality of the Contemporary Horror Film|url=http://www.philipbrophy.com/projects/rstff/Horrality_C.html|journal=Art & Text, Melbourne, 1983|volume=3|issue=Having read the referenced article, the term 'body horror' isn't used...}}</ref> He coined this term to describe an emerging subgenre which occurred during a short golden period for contemporary horror film.<ref>Brophy, Philip. ''"die body crap cut me up smiling"''. ''Philipbrophy.com''. Retrieved from <nowiki>http://www.philipbrophy.com/projects/rstff/Horrality_H.html</nowiki></ref> Although Brophy coined the term to specifically describe a trend within cinema, film director [[Stuart Gordon]] notes that the body horror trope had existed prior to its adaptation to the screen, most notably within fictional writing.<ref>{{Cite book|title=The Mammoth Book of Body Horror|last=Kane, Paul and Marie O'Regan|first=|publisher=Running Press|year=2012|isbn=|location=Philadelphia|pages=}}</ref> <ref name=":1" />
=== Fiction === [[Mary Shelley]]'s ''[[Frankenstein]]'' (1818) is an early example of the body horror subgenre within fictional writing. The success of [[Gothic fiction|gothic horror]] in the 19th century in combination with the birth of [[science fiction]] as a literary form is thought to be the origin of body horror as a literary genre.<ref name=":5" /> According to Halberstam: "By focusing on the body as a locus of fear, Shelley's novel suggests that it is people (or at least bodies) who terrify people... the landscape of fear is replaced by sutured skin."<ref name=":5" />
=== Film === Canadian filmmaker [[David Cronenberg]] is considered a principal originator of body horror through early films such as ''[[Shivers (film)|Shivers]]'' and ''[[Rabid (film)|Rabid]]'', and his remake of ''[[The Fly (1986 film)|The Fly]]''. However, body horror tropes existed within film prior to official recognition of the genre. Early examples of the body horror genre arose out of 1950s American horror cinema including ''[[The Blob]]'' and ''[[The Fly (1958 film)|The Fly]]'', both of which set the standard for the genre due to the films primary focus on bodily mutilation and visceral special effects.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://gehennaandhinnom.wordpress.com/2017/04/07/a-quick-history-of-body-horror-in-cinema/|title=A Quick History of Body Horror in Cinema|date=2017-04-07|work=Gehenna & Hinnom Books|access-date=2018-03-12|language=en-US}}</ref> Many contemporary films of the horror genre (those produced after 1968), including body horror, are considered to be [[Postmodernist film|postmodern]] in contrast to classical horror.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Pinedo|first1= I|date=1996|title= Recreational terror: Postmodern elements of the contemporary horror film|journal=Journal of Film and Video|pages=17–31|jstor=20688091|volume=48|issue=1–2}}</ref> Because of this, delineations between the genres are difficult to define, since postmodernism is concerned with blurring boundaries between categories.
The body horror genre is widely represented throughout [[Japanese horror]] and within contemporary media, such as [[anime]].<ref>Gateward, F. (2002). Bubblegum and heavy metal. ''Sugar, Spice, and Everything Nice: Cinemas of Girlhood'', (29)269, p. 283.</ref> [[Katsuhiro Otomo]]'s 1988 film ''[[Akira (1988 film)|Akira]]'' is an early example of body horror within anime. The film utilizes the genre to explore "notion of the adolescent body as a site of metamorphosis, a metamorphosis that can appear monstrous both to the figure undergoing it and to the outside world."<ref>Napier, S. J. (2001). Akira and Ranma 1/2: The Monstrous Adolescent. In ''Anime from Akira to Princess Mononoke'' (pp. 39–62). Palgrave Macmillan, New York.</ref>
=== Comics and graphic novels === Many [[manga]] authors, or [[mangaka]], such as [[Junji Ito]], specialize in writing within the horror genre and utilize body horror tropes in combination with narrative storytelling devices of [[Japanese horror]].<ref>Bush, L. (2001). ''Asian Horror Encyclopedia: Asian Horror Culture in Literature, Manga, and Folklore''. iUniverse.</ref> Highly influenced by [[H. P. Lovecraft|H.P Lovecraft]], Ito's manga depict obscene body horror through both aesthetic and narrative in order to invoke feelings of [[Abjection|abject]] terror.<ref name=":4" /> In contrast, Canadian cartoonist [[Michael DeForge]] incorporates recurring body horror aspects within his work through less graphic aesthetic and narrative styles.<ref>Jones, T. (2014). "Aw Dude, Gross": The Mundane Body Horror of Michael DeForge.</ref>
== Influences == Films and media that fall under the body horror subgenre reflect a specific corporeal societal anxiety and may provide social commentary about history and influence contemporary culture.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/10/14/movies/do-horror-films-filter-the-horrors-of-history.html|title=Do Horror Films Filter The Horrors of History?|last=Dewan|first=Shaila K.|date=2000-10-14|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-03-15|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
== Controversy and censorship == Since the 18th century, the horror genre has been popular among readers but dismissed as controversial by critics who saw the genre and its thematic elements threatening or dangerous to society.<ref>Cooper, L. A. (2010). ''Gothic Realities: The Impact of Horror Fiction on Modern Culture''. McFarland.</ref>
Owing to the use of graphic and gratuitous violence or themes that may be considered [[taboo]], horror media that fall within the body horror genre are often [[Censorship|censored]] or [[Ban (law)|banned]] across a variety of countries.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/banned-and-brutal-14-beyond-controversial-horror-movies-w446601|title=Banned and Brutal: 14 Beyond-Controversial Horror Movies|last=|first=|date=|website=Rolling Stone|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> For example, the [[The Human Centipede (First Sequence)|Human Centipede]] films have been referred to as "torture porn" and widely criticized to include overly "exploitative, gratuitous portrayals of destructive sexual perversion. That assessment was concretized when several countries – including the UK and Australia – officially banned the sequel in its uncut form."<ref>Jones, S. (2013). No pain, no gain: strategic repulsion and The Human Centipede. ''Cine-Excess Special Issue: Cult Controversies''.</ref>
== See also == *[[List of body horror media]] *[[New French Extremity#Body horror]] *[[Barbara Creed]] *[[Psychological horror|Psychological Horror]] *[[Splatterpunk]] *[[Abjection]]
== References == {{reflist|30em}}

'''A'''ichi
'''R'''ádio and TV| affiliations = [[Japan Radio Network|JRN]]| owner = [[Chunichi Shimbun]] | website = [http://hicbc.com/ hicbc.com]| }} {{Infobox broadcast | call_letters = JOGX-DTV | location = [[Chūbu region|Chubu region]]| digital = 18 ([[ultra high frequency|UHF]])
[[virtual channel|Virtual]]: 5| airdate = December 1, 1956| affiliations = [[Japan News Network|JNN]] | owner = [[Chunichi Shimbun]] | coordinates = {{coord|35|10|20.7|N|136|54|30|E|type:landmark_scale:2000}} | homepage = [http://hicbc.com/ hicbc.com] }} {{Nihongo|'''Chubu-Nippon Broadcasting Co., Ltd.'''|中部日本放送株式会社|Chūbu Nippon Hōsō Kabushiki-gaisha|'''CBC'''}} ([[Nagoya Stock Exchange|NSE]]: [http://www.nse.or.jp/listing/search/detail.html?cd=94020&tab=1 9402]) is a regional [[radio]] and [[television]] service serving [[Nagoya]], [[Aichi Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. Its radio service is affiliated with the [[Japan Radio Network|Japan Radio Network (JRN)]] and its television service affiliated with the [[Japan News Network|Japan News Network (JNN)]] and the [[Tokyo Broadcasting System|TBS]] Network. ==History== CBC was established in 1950 as Japan's first commercial radio broadcaster. Television broadcasts were introduced on December 1, 1956. In 2013, the radio and television companies spun off. CBC also operates the '''C-Wave''' advertising agency. ==Broadcasting== ===Radio=== Frequency *Nagoya (from Nagashima, Mie Prefecture): 1053 kHz: '''JOAR''' (AM); 93.7 MHz (FM) *Gifu (from Kagamigahara, Gifu Prefecture): 639 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Kumano: 720 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Owase: 801 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Hida-Kamioka and Gero: 1062 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Toyohashi: 1485 kHz: '''JOAE''' *Iga-Ueno: 1485 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Takayama: 1557 kHz: '''JOAO''' *Nakatsugawa: 1557 kHz: '''JOAR''' *Shinshiro: 1557 kHz: '''JOAR''' ===TV (Analog)=== '''JOAR-TV''' (1956/12/01-2011/07/24) *Nagoya Main Station ([[Nagoya TV Tower]]) - Channel 5 *Toyohashi - Channel 62 *Toyota - Channel 55 *Gujo - Channel 8 *Gero - Channel 10 *Chuno - Channel 62 *Kumano - Channel 5 *Owase - Channel 6 *Ise - Channel 55 *Nabari - Channel 60 *Toba - Channel 10 *Shima-Isobe - Channel 45, etc. ===TV (Digital)=== '''JOGX-DTV''' (old former callsign: '''JOAR-DTV''') (2003/12/01) *Remote Controller ID 5 *Nagoya Main Starion (Seto Digital Tower) and Nabari - Channel 18 *Toyohashi, Gamagori-Tahara, Chuno, Nakatsugawa, Nagara, Takayama and Ise - Channel 16 ==Programs== ===Radio=== *Weekend Network (Produced by [[Tokyo Broadcasting System]]),(from 17:45 until 17:50 on Saturday (JST)) *Zubari of Makoto Kitano([[:ja:北野誠のズバリ]]),(from 13:00 until 16:00 from Monday to Friday) *[[All Night Nippon]] (Produced by [[Nippon Broadcasting System]]) **All Night Nippon (from 25:00 until 27:00 from Monday to Saturday (JST)) **All Night Nippon R (from 27:00 until 28:00 on Saturday (JST)) *CBC Dragons Night Game (CBCドラゴンズナイター, baseball games of the [[Chunichi Dragons]]) ===TV=== :*[[:ja:3分クッキング|three mitutes cooking]] ;Tabloid TV show :*[[:ja:ゴゴスマ -GO GO!Smile!-]] 13:55-15:50[JST] :*[[:ja:花咲かタイムズ]] 9:25-11:30 every Suterday ;Dramas produced by CBC :"Hirudora" era :*Kippari!! (キッパリ!!, 2nd series) :*Over 30 (オーバー30) :"Dorama 30" era :*Kids War Series (キッズ・ウォー・シリーズ) :*Kippari! (キッパリ!, 1st series) :*Mom, I love you! (ママ・アイラブユー!), etc. ;Sport :*Fight, Dragons! {{CURRENTYEAR}} (燃えよドラゴンズ{{CURRENTYEAR}}, baseball games of the [[Chunichi Dragons]]) :*Sunday Dragons (サンデードラゴンズ) :*[[Chunichi Crowns]] ([[Golf]] tournament) ;Drama and Anime :*[[Monster Rancher (anime)|Monster Farm]] (モンスターファーム, April 17, 1999 - September 30, 2000) :*[[Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Children]] (真・女神転生 デビルチルドレン, October 7, 2000 - September 29, 2001) :*[[Kirby of the Stars]] (星のカービィ, October 6, 2001 - September 27, 2003, every Saturday morning) :*[[Pretty Guardian Sailor Moon (live-action series)|Pretty Guardian Sailor Moon]] (美少女戦士セーラームーン, October 4, 2003 - September 25, 2004, every Saturday morning) ;*[[Ultra Series]] :**[[Ultraman Nexus]] (ウルトラマンネクサス, 2 October 2004 - 25 June 2005, every Saturday at 07:30 until 08:00 [[Japan Standard Time|JST]]) :**[[Ultraman Max]] (ウルトラマンマックス, 2 July 2005 - 1 April 2006, every Saturday at 07:30 until 08:00 [[Japan Standard Time|JST]]) :**[[Ultraman Mebius]] (ウルトラマンメビウス, 8 April 2006 - 31 March 2007, every Saturday at 17:30 until 18:00 [[Japan Standard Time|JST]]) :*[[Romeo x Juliet]] (ロミオ×ジュリエット, April 4, 2007 - September 26, 2007) :*[[Mitsudomoe (manga)|Mitsudomoe]] (2010-2011) :*[[Kotoura-san]] (琴浦さん, January 11, 2013 - March 29, 2013) ==Other TV stations in Nagoya== *[[Tokai Television Broadcasting|Tokai TV]] (東海テレビ) *[[Chukyo TV. Broadcasting|Chukyo TV]] (中京テレビ) *[[Nagoya Broadcasting Network|Metele]] (メ~テレ) *[[Aichi Television Broadcasting|TV Aichi]] (テレビ愛知) ==External links== *[http://hicbc.com/ CBC Official Website] {{TBS Networks}} {{TV-chubu}} [[Category:Japan News Network]] [[Category:Radio in Japan]] [[Category:Television stations in Nagoya]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1951]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1956]]

[[File:Passing a coin through sleeve trick.png|thumb|[[Will Goldston]]'s trick of passing a coin through his sleeve]] '''Coin magic''' is the manipulating of [[coin]]s to entertain audiences.<ref name=wilson> {{cite book | last = Wilson | first = Mark | title = [[Mark Wilson's Complete Course In Magic]] | publisher = Courage Books | origyear = 1975 | year = 1988 | isbn = 0-89471-623-9}}<!--| accessdate = 2008-01-06-->Money Magic, pp. 175-221.</ref> Because coins are small, most coin tricks are considered [[close-up magic]] or table magic, as the audience must be close to the performer to see the effects. Though stage conjurers generally do not use coin effects, coin magic is sometimes performed onstage using large coins. In a different type of performance setting, a close-up coin magician (or 'coin worker') will use a large video projector so the audience can see the magic on a big screen. Coin magic is generally considered harder to master than other close-up techniques such as [[card magic]], as it requires great skill and grace to perform convincingly, and this takes a lot of practice to acquire.
==Elements== Coin effects include productions, vanishes, transformations, transpositions, teleportations, penetrations, restorations, levitations and mental magic—some are combined in a single routine. A simple effect might involve borrowing a coin, making it vanish, concealing the coin, then reproducing it again unexpectedly and returning it to the owner. More complex effects may involve multiple coins, substituting or switching coins and other objects or props can be employed (i.e. [[handkerchief]]s, [[glasses]]) as well as the coins. However, the power of most coin magic lies in its simplicity and the solidity of the object; the basic skills of [[sleight of hand]] and misdirection often appear most magical without complex equipment. Almost any audience will be amazed by the simplest mystery, such as passing a coin through a table.
==Sleights and tricks== {{Confusing|date=June 2010}} <!-- This section may need a more detailed description for each act. Comment from User:Davtra -->
Some classic coin magic effects: *Coin vanish - making a coin seemingly vanish. *Coin production - making a coin seemingly appear. *Transposition - making two coins switch places
Some classic coin magic plots: *[[Miser's Dream]] - Grabbing multiple coins from thin air. Popularized by T. Nelson Downs, who would drop coin after coin into a borrowed top hat. *Coins Across - The magical transfer of multiple coins from one hand to another. *Three fly - A coins across type effect involving three coins ''visually'' transferring from one hand to another. *Matrix - Impossibly moving four coins under the cover of playing cards. *Chink-a-chink - A bare-handed Matrix. *[[Coins Through Table]] - Coins penetrate through the surface of the table. *Coin Bite - Taking a bite out of a coin then visually restoring it right in front of the spectator. *Spellbound - Visually changing one coin into another, while only showing one coin at all times. *Coins to Glass - Similar to coins across - coins transfer from one hand to a glass. *Tenkai Pennies - A two coin routine where one coin travels from one hand to the other. *Coin to bottle - A coin is slammed into a sealed bottle.
A sampling of coin sleights and moves: *[[Palming]] - A form of concealment. *[[Sleeving]] - A form of concealment. *Lapping - A form of ditching a coin. *[[The French Drop]] - a retention of vision coin vanish involving the Passing of a coin from one hand to the other than making it disappear. *The Muscle Pass - Shooting a coin from one hand to the other, this can be done in such a way that can make the coin look as if it’s defying gravity
==Coin magicians== Some magicians widely known for coin magic include: * [[Thomas Nelson Downs]] (considered, along with J.B. Bobo, one of the magicians key to the development and teaching of modern coin magic) * [[J.B. Bobo]] (author of Modern Coin Magic, a core reference and starting point for coin magicians) * [[Tony Slydini]] (a well-known magician whose style of magic transformed close-up magic including his impressive coin routines) * [[Dai Vernon]] * [[Ed Marlo]] * [[David Roth]] (most important developer of coin magic in the twentieth century and inventor of the standard plots common in current coin magic) * [[Larry Jennings]] * [[Michael Ammar]] (one of the most prolific publishers and teachers, an experienced all around magician, including coin work) * [[Dean Dill]] (coin magician and inventor who has appeared on television and also works as a barber) * [[Michael Vincent (magician)|Michael Vincent]] * [[Shoot Ogawa]] (Last Vegas restaurant performer known for highly stylized, high-difficulty, impressive coin magic) * [[Apollo Robbins]] (contemporary of Shoot Ogawa and co-contributor to a number coin teaching materials) * [[David Stone (magician)|David Stone]] (talented performer and teacher of fast-paced, flashy coin magic) * [[Rocco Silano]] * [[Jay Sankey]] * [[Rich Ferguson (magician)|Rich Ferguson]] (author of Chip Tricks, a magician and mentalist who has authored various magic instructional videos) * [[Luis Piedrahita]] * [[Michael Rubinstein]] * [[Mike Gallo]] * [[Chris Kenner]] * [[Paul Cummins]]
==Performance== Although some coin magic use [[gimmick]]s (e.g. modified coins or trick coins), such gimmicks usually do not entirely create the magical effect. Gimmicked coins are made by several major manufacturers, such as Sterling, Johnson, Sasco or Tango Magic. Producing a memorable mystery requires significant skill in presenting the effect and utilizing misdirection to distract the audience from the secret of the gimmick. A performer who relies entirely on special equipment may not impress an audience. Many people are more impressed by an effect which depends (or seems to depend) entirely on skillful manipulation and misdirection than by an effect which appears to depend to some extent on specially made props. A performer who has mastered the basic skills can nonetheless use gimmicks to powerful effect without it being obvious to the audience. Some prefer not to use gimmicks at all, though most well-known coin magicians do use simple coin gimmicks.
==In literature== Canadian novelist [[Robertson Davies]] devotes a good part of his ''[[The Deptford Trilogy|Deptford Trilogy]]'' to the art of coin magic. All three novels follow in part or wholly the career of a fictitious magician, Magnus Eisengrim, who was abducted as a boy by a traveling circus and learned his craft while concealed in a papier-mâché automaton. The descriptions of coin magic throughout are remarkable for their clarity. The final novel in the series, [[World of Wonders (novel)|World of Wonders]], details his life and career.
In the [[Neil Gaiman]] novel ''[[American Gods]]'', the main character, Shadow, is experienced with coin magic, and many different tricks and aspects of coin magic are discussed in the book.
In the [[Dean Koontz]] novel ''[[From the Corner of His Eye]]'', a police officer uses coin magic to interrogate suspects.
[[Stock character|Thieves, wizards, and jesters]], in historical and fantasy literature are often depicted as being skilled in sleight of hand, and are often depicted doing standard coin magic. [[Coin walk|Rolling a coin across the knuckles]] (coin walking) is a popular image. Silk in [[David Eddings]]'s ''[[Belgariad]]'', and [[Mat Cauthon]] and [[Thom Merrilin]] in [[Robert Jordan]]'s ''[[Wheel of Time]]'' do this frequently. Johnny Depp's whimsical character Jack Sparrow coin walks in the end of [[Pirates of the Caribbean]]. Also, [[Vila Restal]] in the [[BBC]] [[science fiction]] television program ''[[Blake's 7]]'' mixed his skills as a thief with such tricks.
==See also== *[[Coin manipulation]]
